author: Joseph Choi
description: President Trump on Monday gave personal suggestions on how and when parents should have children receive certain vaccines, offering advice that he said was based on his own feelings during a press event that claimed links between Tylenol, vaccinations and autism. “We want no mercury in the vaccine. We want no aluminum in the vaccine. The MMR...
title: Trump suggests changes to childhood vaccine schedule ‘based on what I feel’

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday signed an order designating the anti-fascist movement antifa as a domestic terrorist organization, following through on a pledge in the wake of the killing of Charlie Kirk to crack down on left-wing groups. The order designates antifa as a “domestic terrorist organization.” It gives government agencies a broad mandate to investigate any...
title: Trump signs order labeling antifa 'domestic terrorist organization'

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Supreme Court to weigh protections for agencies The Supreme Court agreed Monday to formally consider overruling its 90-year-old precedent that enables Congress to provide certain agencies with a degree of independence from the White House, a major test of...
title: Supreme Court upholds FTC firings

author: Max Rego
description: Turning Point USA will continue the college tour its late founder Charlie Kirk began, with conservative figures set to appear on campuses across the country. The tour will re-start Monday at the University of Minnesota, the organization announced on Monday. Conservative commentator Michael Knowles will host the event.  Kirk, 31, was fatally shot on Sept....
title: Turning Point USA will return to campuses with lineup of conservative stars

author: Julia Shapero
description: {beacon} Technology Technology   The Big Story  TikTok deal takes shape Oracle will provide security for the new TikTok entity in the United States, following the President Trump-backed deal to allow the social media company to keep operating in the U.S. © Damian Dovarganes, Associated Press The proposal will “allow Oracle, as the security provider...
title: Trump's TikTok deal

author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Judge allows wind farm to resume construction Bucking the Trump administration, a federal judge has ruled that a nearly complete offshore wind project can continue construction for the time being. © AP Photo/Michael Dwyer, File Judge Royce Lamberth, a Reagan appointee, granted a preliminary injunction Monday that temporarily allows...
title: Start the revolution (wind)

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: In a unanimous decision, the Democratic caucus in the Senate wrote a letter on Monday in opposition to the Trump administration’s proposal to ax a 2009 endangerment finding, an Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) determination that concluded that the accumulation of six greenhouse gases posed a serious threat to public health. The proposal would also repeal...
title: Every Democratic senator opposes EPA plan to ax endangerment finding

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said Monday it would not follow California’s new law banning its agents from covering their faces during enforcement operations. “To be clear: We will NOT comply with [California Gov.] Gavin Newsom’s unconstitutional mask ban,” DHS said Monday in a post on the social platform X. DHS suggested the masks...
title: DHS says ICE won't comply with California ban on agents wearing masks

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump will meet this week with Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) to discuss government funding ahead of a potential shutdown, a White House official told The Hill. Punchbowl first reported on the upcoming meeting. The president is set to travel to New York for the United Nations...
title: Trump to meet with Schumer, Jeffries on preventing looming shutdown

author: Max Rego
description: A man has been charged with pointing a laser beam at Marine One while President Trump was on board on Saturday, according to a signed affidavit.  The affidavit, signed by Secret Service Officer Diego Santiago, alleges that Jacob Samuel Winkler pointed a red laser beam at Santiago, before pointing it in the direction of Marine...
title: Man charged with allegedly pointing laser at Marine One with Trump on board

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Morgan Murphy, a former top Trump administration official who also served as a top aide to Sen. Tommy Tuberville (R-Ala.), is launching a bid for his former boss’s seat next year for Alabama Senate.  Tuberville is leaving the Senate to run for governor, creating a vacancy in the deep-red states. Murphy touts himself as a...
title: Ex-Trump official launches bid for Tuberville's seat in Alabama

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Satisfaction with the direction of the country reached its lowest point of President Trump’s second term in office, according to the latest Gallup poll, though views remain broadly more positive than before he took office. Twenty-nine percent of the country say they’re satisfied “with the way things are going in the United States at this...
title: Satisfaction with US direction lowest in Trump's second term: Gallup

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Disney says it will reinstate comedian Jimmy Kimmel on Tuesday after pulling the late night host off the air. The company said in a statement shared with multiple media outlets it took the comedian off the air "to avoid further inflaming a tense situation at an emotional moment for the country." Kimmel had been taken...
title: Jimmy Kimmel to return Tuesday after Disney lifts suspension over Charlie Kirk comments

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Bucking the Trump administration, a federal judge has ruled that a nearly complete offshore wind project can continue construction for the time being. Judge Royce Lamberth, a Reagan appointee, granted a preliminary injunction Monday that temporarily allows Revolution Wind to keep building its wind farm off the coast of Rhode Island. Lamberth wrote that the...
title: Judge allows wind farm halted by Trump to resume construction

author: Amie Parnes
description: Democrats are frustrated with former Vice President Kamala Harris, arguing her new book is picking fights and causing divisions at the worst possible time for the party.  They say Harris’s memoir, 107 Days, which will be out publicly on Tuesday, comes at a time when the party is attempting to find their way out of the wilderness...
title: Democrats express frustrations with Harris for picking fights in upcoming book

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: For years, MAGA conservatives decried censorship, railing against so-called liberal cancel culture. But now? Some of those same voices are playing the censorship card themselves. And the biggest hypocrite of them all might be Donald Trump.
title: Conservatives push back on 'woke right' FCC censorship of Kimmel

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Josh Gottheimer (D-N.J.) said Monday that New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani “should be in the Socialist Party, not in the Democratic Party.” “Listen, I — I think he's a very impressive candidate and — right? And I'm not taking that away from him, but — my problem is that he's a socialist,...
title: New Jersey rep: Mamdani 'should be in the Socialist Party, not in the Democratic Party'

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court agreed Monday to decide whether it should overrule its 90-year-old precedent that enables Congress to provide certain agencies with a degree of independence from the White House, a major test of President Trump’s expansive assertion of presidential power. The justices are set to review Trump’s contention that he can fire independent agency leaders...
title: Supreme Court agrees to decide Trump’s firing power at independent agencies

author: Max Rego
description: Auburn men’s basketball coach Bruce Pearl, seen as a potential Republican Senate candidate in Alabama, is retiring, but says Washington D.C. is not in his future. "Many of you know that I thought and prayed about maybe running for United States Senate, maybe to be the next great senator from the state of Alabama," Pearl...
title: Bruce Pearl retires as Auburn coach; says no to Senate run

author: Julia Shapero
description: Google made the case Monday to a Virginia judge that it should be permitted to hold onto several key portions of its advertising technology ecosystem, just weeks after avoiding a breakup of its online search business.  The tech giant is in court yet again, as the Department of Justice (DOJ) argues the company should be...
title: Google seeks to hold onto ad tech business after avoiding search breakup

author: Alex Gangitano
description: The White House on Monday defended border czar Tom Homan after MSNBC reported he was investigated by the Biden adminsitration of bribery, stressing that President Trump stands by him. “Mr. Homan never took the $50,000 that you're referring to, so you should get your facts straight. Number one,” White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt told...
title: White House: Trump ‘stands by’ Homan amid allegations of bribery

author: William Liang, opinion contributor
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi has been accused of attempting to import the idea of "hate speech" as a legal category of crime, in order to tighten the screws on civil liberties.
title: Pam Bondi’s free speech blunder is no accident

author: Julia Manchester
description: Democratic New York City mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani said on Monday he is canceling a town hall with WABC in New York over Disney’s decision to indefinitely suspend Jimmy Kimmel from his late night show. ABC did so following pressure from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) over comments the comedian made about the suspect in...
title: Mamdani cancels televised town hall with WABC News over Kimmel suspension

description: 12:30 Report is The Hill's midday newsletter. Click here to subscribe. In today's issue: • Trump’s expected autism announcement • Erika Kirk offers forgiveness at memorial • Congress careens toward shutdown • Pentagon issues reporter restrictions • Trump border czar in spotlight 💊 IN THE WHITE HOUSE Trump teases autism announcement: President Trump is expected to make an...

author: Josh DuBose
description: A 45-year-old man from Argentina plummeted some 2,000 feet to his death on Mt. Shasta earlier this month, officials have announced.

description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt is scheduled to brief reporters on Monday afternoon as a government shutdown looms. Congress is moving toward a shutdown after the Senate voted down a pair of stopgap spending bills, including a “clean” one proposed by the GOP to keep the lights on for seven weeks while appropriators hammer out a...

author: Aron Solomon, opinion contributor
description: Kimmel’s suspension may look like another culture-war dust-up, but it’s really a test of how fragile free expression becomes when broadcast rules collide with politics.
title: When comedy meets the FCC: What Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension really tells us

author: Tara Suter
description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged deadly drone strikes ahead of the United Nations General Assembly kicking off in New York this week. “Rescue efforts and rubble clearing continue after the Russian strike on Zaporizhzhia — guided aerial bombs targeted civilian infrastructure, ordinary homes. Fifteen apartment buildings and ten private houses have been damaged,” Ukrainian President Volodymyr...
title: Russia, Ukraine exchange deadly drone strikes ahead of UN General Assembly

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Ryan Routh, who is accused of attempting to assassinate President Trump last year at a Florida country club, is expected to call three witnesses as his defense begins on Monday. Routh, who is defending himself, said he plans on calling a firearms expert and two character witnesses. Prosecutors, who questioned 38 witnesses before resting their...
title: Man accused of trying to kill Trump to call 3 defense witnesses

author: Addy Bink
description: Over 85,000 packages of shrimp sold at Kroger stores in 31 states have been recalled over potential radioactive contamination.
title: Check your freezer: Shrimp sold in 31 states recalled over radioactive threat

author: Rodney Overton
description: A massive search was conducted Sunday night for several children who escaped a psychiatric hospital in North Carolina, police said.
title: 7 children found after escape from North Carolina psychiatric hospital

author: Rachel Tucker
description: ORLANDO, Fla. (WFLA) -- Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier announced a new tool for "combating violent extremism" in a news conference in Orlando on Monday. Uthmeier was joined by Statewide Prosecutor Brad McVay, Education Commissioner Anastasios Kamoutsas and Valencia College Board Member Michael Sasso for the announcement. Uthmeier said the portal will be used by...
title: Florida AG launches 'combat violent extremism' portal

author: William S. Becker, opinion contributor
description: It’s time to breathe life back into the document and strengthen it. It is not carved in stone.
title: The Constitution is failing us — so let’s fix it

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The American Library Association (ALA) announced Monday that George Takei will be its honorary chair for Banned Books Week, coming up Oct. 5-11.   Takei, an award-winning actor, New York Times best-selling author and activist, will aim to spread awareness on book bans and censorship, according to the group.  “Books are an essential foundation of...
title: George Takei named Banned Books Week honorary chair

author: Tara Suter
description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro (D) said Sunday that the federal government's role in getting late-night host Jimmy Kimmel pulled off the air was "extremely dangerous" to the principle of free speech in America. NBC News’s Kristen Welker asked Shapiro on “Meet the Press" for his response to Kimmel's suspension by ABC, which was spurred by...
title: Shapiro: Freedom of speech 'being undermined by the long arm of the federal government'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump downplayed his reunion on Sunday with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, a formerly close ally whose public split with the president drew widespread attention earlier this year. Speaking to reporters on Air Force One, Trump said he appreciated that Musk greeted him at the memorial service for conservative activist Charlie Kirk. “Well, Elon came...
title: Trump downplays Musk reunion: 'Elon came over and said hello'

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: As the saying goes, a promise is only as good as the person who makes it.
title: Trump is breaking his most important promises and keeping the worst

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Juan Williams reflects on the legacy of Turning Point USA founder Charlie Kirk and the importance of free speech, while criticizing Attorney General Pam Bondi for her comments on punishing "hate speech" and the Trump administration's efforts to stifle critics.
title: Let's talk — no muzzle on me or you

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung in an interview with Reuters said his country cannnot afford to meet President Trump's demands that it invest $350 billion into America in exchange for the removal of punishing tariffs.  "Without a currency swap, if we were to withdraw $350 billion in the manner that the U.S. is demanding...
title: South Korean president says his country can't afford Trump's demands

description: The White House launches Monday into a week of big events, from a major health care announcement to the United Nations General Assembly to a visit from a key U.S. ally. President Trump and Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will make an announcement on autism at 4 p.m. Monday. Previewing it...
title: Live updates: Trump teases big autism news; clock ticks toward government shutdown

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Officials in the Dominican Republic said they confiscated approximately 1,000 kilograms of suspected cocaine from a speedboat targeted recently in a U.S. airstrike in the southern Caribbean. At a press conference, local officials said the National Drug Control Directorate (DNCD) and the Dominican Republic Navy seized 377 packages of suspected cocaine from the boat about...
title: 1,000 kilos of cocaine seized from boat US targeted, Dominican Republic says

author: Douglas Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributors
description: If these races go to the Democrats, this will give them positive momentum looking ahead to the midterms, despite the lingering challenges still facing the party on a national level.
title: Democrats seek an off-year election boost in New Jersey and Virginia

description: This oversimplified narrative conceals the real drivers of upheaval while implicitly condoning violence.

author: Jared Gans
description: Trump and all the big names in MAGA joined together to honor conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

author: Mike Lillis
description: Congress is cruising at a steady clip toward a government shutdown at the end of the month, with both parties — and both chambers — pointing fingers at the other while refusing to blink.  Lawmakers from both chambers are in their home states this week after the House passed a GOP-crafted government funding bill that...
title: Congress locked in game of shutdown chicken as funding deadline nears

author: Surina Venkat
description: Charlie Kirk’s assassination earlier this month spurred rare calls from the right for more for content moderation measures on social media.  At least two Republican lawmakers backed calls for social media platforms to remove graphic videos of the shooting, another called for lifetime bans for users who celebrated Kirk’s murder, while a senior Trump administration...
title: GOP's calls for Charlie Kirk social media crackdown hit roadblocks

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s campaign to oust service members celebrating or mocking the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk online has already seen at least eight people suspended or placed under investigation, with legal experts warning of a chilling effect on free speech. The disciplinary actions — including suspensions of at least five Army officers and...
title: Hegseth's purge of service members cheering Kirk killing comes under heavy scrutiny

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: President Trump’s firings at the Federal Reserve and other agencies with traditional independence from the political forces of the White House have presented the Supreme Court with a critical opportunity to settle weighty questions over the bounds of presidential power.  Pressure was already building after the administration this month urged the justices to take up...
title: Trump’s independent agency firings bombard Supreme Court

author: Tara Suter
description: Hundreds took part in a historic swim in the Chicago River on Sunday, according to multiple reports. The Guardian reported that the organized swim was the first of its kind in close to 100 years. The number of participants in the event came close to 300, according to The Chicago Sun-Times. “Reclaiming our river not...
title: Hundreds take part in organized swim in Chicago River for the first time in 100 years

author: Tara Suter
description: The Trump administration has terminated an annual government hunger report, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) said Saturday. “The U.S. Department of Agriculture announced the termination of future Household Food Security Reports. These redundant, costly, politicized, and extraneous studies do nothing more than fear monger,” the USDA said Saturday in a press release. “For 30...
title: Trump administration halts government hunger report

author: Brett Samuels
description: Tens of thousands of people gathered in Arizona on Sunday for a memorial service honoring conservative activist Charlie Kirk, who was killed during a campus event in Utah earlier this month. The event was held at State Farm Stadium in Glendale and drew dozens of Trump administration officials, GOP lawmakers and prominent conservatives, along with...
title: Charlie Kirk memorial: 5 takeaways
